section.p: A region in OpenStack terms is a collection of URLs that together provide a consistent set of services (Nova, Neutron, Swift, etc). Regions are represented in the Keystone identity service catalog and clients can decide which region they want to use.
For the owner of a cloud, regions provide a way of segmenting resources for scale, resilience, and isolation.

sectiondiv.p:
Regions don't have to be disjointed; for example, you can have a Swift service shared across more than one region, in which case the Swift URL for both regions will be the same and any region-specific services will use the same Swift instance.
However, not all services can be shared in this way. For example, a Neutron service cannot be used by more than one Nova and so these will generally be deployed as region specific services, provided from separate control-planes.
Equally in , Mysql and RabbitMQ cannot be shared by more than one instance of the same service (for example a single mysql cluster cannot be used by two different instances of Nova, and so these are also deployed on a per-control basis.
